articles.headline: Former Governor in Virginia Guilty in Bribery Case
articles.snippet: Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, were convicted of doing favors for a businessman in exchange for gifts and loans.
articles.abstract: Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, were convicted of doing favors for a businessman in exchange for gifts and loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND, Va. — Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, were convicted of corruption in federal court on Thursday, after a trial that shattered the political career of the onetime Republican star and peeled back the couple’s private life to the bone.

articles.headline: Apple Plans Smartwatch and Larger iPhones
articles.snippet: The watch, which is expected to include fitness tracking and wireless payment, will be the first new product unveiled under Tim Cook, who replaced Steve Jobs in 2011.
articles.abstract: The watch, which is expected to include fitness tracking and wireless payment, will be the first new product unveiled under Tim Cook, who replaced Steve Jobs in 2011.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Apple wants to make a big splash, it returns to its history.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Allows First Use of a Novel Cancer Drug
articles.snippet: The treatment unleashes the body’s immune system against tumors, and will initially be used against advanced melanoma.
articles.abstract: The treatment unleashes the body’s immune system against tumors, and will initially be used against advanced melanoma.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved the first of an eagerly awaited new class of cancer drugs that unleashes the body’s immune system to fight tumors.

articles.headline: Liquidity for Banks, This Time Defined
articles.snippet: The rules the Federal Reserve approved this week are intended to ensure that banks have enough ready liquidity to survive a crisis of 30 days, which proved not to be the case in the 2008 crisis.
articles.abstract: The rules the Federal Reserve approved this week are intended to ensure that banks have enough ready liquidity to survive a crisis of 30 days, which proved not to be the case in the 2008 crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: “The total capital ratio is well in excess of the 10 percent regulatory threshold.”

articles.headline: Nevada a Winner in Tesla’s Battery Contest
articles.snippet: The company hopes the construction of a factory in Nevada will catalyze the entry of the electric car into the American market and provide as many as 6,500 manufacturing jobs.
articles.abstract: The company hopes the construction of a factory in Nevada will catalyze the entry of the electric car into the American market and provide as many as 6,500 manufacturing jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: After pitting five potential host states against one another in a quest for hundreds of millions of dollars in incentives, Tesla Motors said Thursday that it had struck a deal with Nevada for construction of its sprawling factory to build batteries for electric cars and the power grid.

articles.headline: On Ukraine, the West Sidesteps a Fraught Term
articles.snippet: After four months of fighting in eastern Ukraine, few countries have chosen the word “invasion” to describe the slow-burning war.
articles.abstract: After four months of fighting in eastern Ukraine, few countries have chosen the word “invasion” to describe the slow-burning war.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Whether on the streets of Budapest in 1956, the mountains of Afghanistan in 1979 and again in 2001 or in the swampy forests of Grenada in 1983, invasions have tended to be noisy, unmistakable affairs that screamed their purpose from the start.

articles.headline: Job Growth Is Sluggish, Raising Fear of Malaise
articles.snippet: With only 142,000 jobs added, August was the first month since January in which the economy failed to add at least 200,000 jobs. Unemployment fell slightly to 6.1 percent.
articles.abstract: With only 142,000 jobs added, August was the first month since January in which the economy failed to add at least 200,000 jobs. Unemployment fell slightly to 6.1 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Missing: nearly three million American workers.

articles.headline: Ukraine Deal Imposes Truce Putin Devised
articles.snippet: Whether the cease-fire between Ukraine’s government and separatists lasts will probably be determined by the outcome of negotiations over the political future of the southeastern region.
articles.abstract: Whether the cease-fire between Ukraine’s government and separatists lasts will probably be determined by the outcome of negotiations over the political future of the southeastern region.
articles.lead_paragraph: KIEV, Ukraine — After five months of intensifying combat that threatened to rip Ukraine apart and to reignite the Cold War, the Ukrainian government and separatist forces signed a cease-fire agreement on Friday that analysts considered highly tenuous in a country that remains a tinderbox.

articles.headline: Ebola Is Taking a Second Toll, on Economies
articles.snippet: The disease, and the hysteria it has caused, is already having a serious economic impact, in part because some countries are closing down borders.
articles.abstract: The disease, and the hysteria it has caused, is already having a serious economic impact, in part because some countries are closing down borders.
articles.lead_paragraph: DAKAR, Senegal — Airlines have canceled their flights to the countries most affected. Prices of staple goods are going up, and food supplies are dwindling. Border posts are being closed, foreign workers are going home and national growth rates are projected to plummet.

articles.headline: Corner Closet Opens Up a Bit Wider
articles.snippet: Trevor Burgess of C1 Financial and Jason Grenfell-Gardner of IGI Laboratories are part of a generation that doesn’t conceal sexual orientation.
articles.abstract: Trevor Burgess of C1 Financial and Jason Grenfell-Gardner of IGI Laboratories are part of a generation that doesn’t conceal sexual orientation.
articles.lead_paragraph: After C1 Financial’s chief executive, Trevor Burgess, rang the opening bell and posed outside the New York Stock Exchange with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers cheerleaders on Aug. 14 to celebrate his Florida-based company’s first day of trading, he received a message from Jason Grenfell-Gardner, the chief executive of the pharmaceutical company IGI Laboratories:

articles.headline: Obama Enlists 9 Allies to Help in the Battle Against ISIS
articles.snippet: President Obama escalated the response to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, recruiting allies to help crush the group and outlining a strategy that echoes the war on terror.
articles.abstract: President Obama escalated the response to the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, recruiting allies to help crush the group and outlining a strategy that echoes the war on terror.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEWPORT, Wales — President Obama escalated the American response to the marauding Islamic State in Iraq and Syria on Friday, recruiting at least nine allies to help crush the organization and offering the outlines of a coordinated military strategy that echoes the war on terror developed by his predecessor, George W. Bush, more than a decade ago.
